items.value: Photovoltaic IV Characteristics Objective: To investigate the IV (current-voltage) characteristics of three solar panels connected in series using a voltmeter and an ammeter. Materials: • Three identical solar panels • Voltmeter • Ammeter • Connecting wires • Light source (a high-intensity lamp) • Mounting stand or surface for the solar panels • Notebook for recording observations Note: This experiment can provide insight into the behavior of solar panels in series and is fundamental in understanding solar panel configurations in real-world applications.
Welcome to our virtual lab for solar panel testing! We are delighted to have you with us and wish you an enriching and enjoyable learning experience. Explore, learn, and innovate.
Connect the first solar panel to the second, and then the second solar panel to the third, so that all panels are connected in series
Connect the positive pole of the voltmeter to the positive pole of the first solar panel and the negative pole to the negative pole of the third solar panel
Connect each of the solar cells, the ammeter, and the variable resistor in series
Change the resistor value and record the voltage and current values
